name: Tamioo nikki vol.1+2
description: Volume 1 & 2: Asia + India - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - India , Japan , Taiwan , Hongkong , Vietnam , China , Tibet , Nepal , Thailand - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Volume 1 & 2: "I never intended to publish a book." During my first backpacking trip, I carried a small journal and recorded what I saw. I showed it to a friend, who suggested I make a book. So I did, with an exacto knife, glue, and a printer. This was the genesis of Tamio Nikki. The handmade copies I made sold surprisingly well at a local shop, so I decided to have more copies printed in Shanghai. Volume 1 - India The first in the series chronicles my first backpacking experience in chaotic India. Volume 2 - Asia Sneaking into Tibet, pretending to be Chinese, bribing hostels not to rat me out, and dodging the police along the way, I made it to Mount Kailash and ancient kingdom of Guge. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - What is the "Tamio Nikki" series: I, Tamio, traveled the world with a tiny backpack and a tiny journal. I recorded what I found with surprisingly intricate letters and drawings. "Tamioo Nikki" is an actual-size copy of my art work. I don't know if you can read it, but I hope you enjoy it. This book is an exact replica of my travel journal. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ★Link to more photos ↓↓ http://www.tamioonews.com/english/book1+2.html - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 376 pages Full color Paperback size W10.5 X H14 X D2.5(cm) Language: Japanese Printed in Shanghai in 2011 Copyright 2011

name: Tamioo nikki vol.3
description: Volume 3: Eastern Europe + Central,South America Edition - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Austria , Czech , Poland , Ukraine , Turkey , Georgia Mexico , Cuba , Guatemala , Columbia , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Chile , Argentina , Paraguay - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Volume 3: "I can travel without money." The third installment of the crazy book that chooses its readers. This time, it's Eastern Europe and Latin America: an account of a 16 country, eight-month trip. Each day recorded in photographs, drawings, and written records. The beautiful streets of socialist Ukraine and public fights with shopkeepers. In Peru, I traveled the unseen world on a psychedelic trip guided by a shaman. An insane attempt on the tallest mountain in South America, Aconcagua (6962m). Working from the road on my laptop. I hope you feel the joy and beauty of travel. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - What is the "Tamio Nikki" series: I, Tamio, traveled the world with a tiny backpack and a tiny journal. I recorded what I found with surprisingly intricate letters and drawings. "Tamioo Nikki" is an actual-size copy of my art work. I don't know if you can read it, but I hope you enjoy it. This book is an exact replica of my travel journal. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ★Link to more photos ↓↓ http://www.tamioonews.com/english/book3.html - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 286 pages Full color - brown paper Paperback size W10.5 X H14 X D2(cm) Language: Japanese Printed in Shanghai in 2011 Copyright 2011

name: Tamioo nikki vol.4
description: Volume 4: Shanghai + Everest trek + India - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Shanghai , USA , Thailand , India , Nepal , Everest trek , India , Thailand - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Volume 4: "I read it and I loved it!" The long-awaited fourth installment. Goodbye to Volume 1 and 2's insane days of printing, cutting, and gluing together each individual book. But how did this author manage to get his book printed in Shanghai by himself?! This volume recounts the industrial revolution of "Tamio Nikki"! Couchsurfing in India with my American girlfriend. Trekking from Lukla, Nepal (altitude 2900m) to the Everest base camp (altitude 5364m). Fighting altitude sickness and each other, we finally saw the beauty of Mt Everest. And witnessed the Kumbh Mela festival, a once every 6 year gathering of holy men in India. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - What is the "Tamio Nikki" series: I, Tamio, traveled the world with a tiny backpack and a tiny journal. I recorded what I found with surprisingly intricate letters and drawings. "Tamioo Nikki" is an actual-size copy of my art work. I don't know if you can read it, but I hope you enjoy it.
